intro: Antirrhinum majus subsp. ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous snapdragon, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to both ornamental and ecological landscapes.
